original: Lindström, Martin Leopold, konstnär, Kättilstad, f. 15/11/94 i Sthlm. Privatstud. samt stud:resor i Norge, Danm., Tyskl., Ö’Sterr. o. Ital. Sep :-utställn. i Sthlm, Norrköp., Linköp., Borås, Karlstad o. Oslo, delt. i nord. utställn. i Gbgs mässhall 39. Repr. i Nat:mus. samt mus. i Norrköp., Linköp., Borås o. Hudiksvall. Utfört måln. i Frimurarhot. i Linköp.
translated: Lindström, Martin Leopold, artist, born on November 15th, 1894 in Stockholm. Private studies and study trips in Norway, Denmark, Germany, Austria, and Italy. September: exhibitions in Stockholm, Norrköping, Linköping, Borås, Karlstad, and Oslo. Participated in Nordic exhibitions in Gothenburg's exhibition hall in 1939. Represented in the National Museum and museums in Norrköping, Linköping, Borås, and Hudiksvall. Created a painting in the Freemason Lodge in Linköping.

structured.name: Martin Leopold Lindström
structured.description: Martin Leopold Lindström was a Swedish artist born on November 15th, 1894 in Stockholm. He studied privately and went on study trips to Norway, Denmark, Germany, Austria, and Italy. In September, he participated in exhibitions held in Stockholm, Norrköping, Linköping, Borås, Karlstad, and Oslo. In 1939, he also took part in the Nordic exhibitions held in Gothenburg's exhibition hall. Martin's work is represented in the National Museum, as well as museums in Norrköping, Linköping, Borås, and Hudiksvall. He also created a painting in the Freemason Lodge in Linköping.
